alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Oklahoma County through 845 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Oklahoma City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, southeastern Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Choctaw, The Village, Harrah, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Luther, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base, Newalla, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, Smith Village, The Capitol, and The Fairgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 123 and 140. Interstate 40 between mile markers 146 and 165. Interstate 44 between mile markers 117 and 151. Interstate 240 between mile markers 15 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
